purpose: Enable employees to request company-approved devices through a self-service Power App, triggering approval workflows and integrating with internal policies.

mvp_components.app_details: A self-service app for employees to browse and request devices.

app_screens.screen_details: Allows users to browse available devices, view specs, photos, and availability, and filter by department-approved models.
Form for selecting a device, justifying business need, selecting urgency level, and auto-populating employee details from Azure AD.

features.feat_0006: Auto-Populate User Details from Azure AD
features.feat_0017: Responsive Design for Multiple Device Types

mvp_components.flow_details: Workflow for managing the approval process of device requests.

flow_actions.action_details: Managers receive a notification when there is a new request to approve.
Managers can approve or reject the request with comments within a 2 business day SLA.

post_mvp_modules.details: Add a screen to the app for employees to view the status of their requests and receive email notifications at each step.
post_mvp_modules.recommendation: Integrate a Power BI dashboard within the app for a comprehensive tracking solution that provides real-time insights and analytics.

post_mvp_modules.details: Extend the workflow to allow IT Administrators to update stock levels, mark orders as fulfilled, and link to the procurement system (e.g., SAP).
post_mvp_modules.recommendation: Develop a model-driven app for IT Administrators to manage inventory, which can be integrated with the existing workflow for a seamless experience.

integration_points: Auto-populate employee name/department from Azure AD
Link to procurement system (e.g., SAP) for inventory management
notes: The MVP focuses on the core functionality of device ordering and approval. Post-MVP features will enhance the system with tracking and inventory management capabilities.
